text: Tebhaga Express is an Mail/Express train belonging to Eastern Railway Zone that runs between Kolkata and Balurghat. It is operated with 13161 / 13162 train numbers on a hexa-weekly basis. == Overview == The train is named after the Tebhaga movement of Bengal, as the strike also took place in Balurghat. It runs on a hexa-weekly basis and connects important stations such as Barddhaman, Shantiniketan, Malda Town and Buniadpur. It is a fully day train providing reserved and unreserved coaches and as well as Tatkal scheme. The train is known for its punctuality and cleanliness. The 13161/KOAA-BLGT Tebhaga Express has an average speed of 46 km/h and covers 441 km in 9h 40m. The 13162/BLGT-KOAA Tebhaga Express has an average speed of 50 km/h and covers same distance in 8h 55m. ==Timing== From Platform #3 of Kolkata, the train departs at 12:55 IST and arrives at Platform #1 of Balurghat at 22:35 IST. From Platform #1 of Balurghat, the train departs at 5:45 IST and arrives at Platform #4 of Kolkata at 14:25 IST. ==Route & Halts== The important stops of the train are: * Kolkata * Barddhaman Junction * Bolpur Shantiniketan * Rampurhat * Pakur * New Farakka Junction * Malda Town * Eklakhi Junction * Gazole * Buniadpur * Gangarampur * Balurghat ==Classes== The train used to run with 12 standard ICF Coaches. From December 2017, a new coach has been attached to it. * 1 AC III Tier (economy) (recently added) * 2 chair cars * 8 general unreserved * 2 seating (ladies/disabled) cum luggage rakes * 1 CC Frome is under electrification, a Barddhaman loco shed based WDM 3A diesel locomotive pulls the train to its destination. ==References== * Indian Railways Category:Transport in Kolkata Category:Named
